conversation.content:
Here is a rant I wrote to my girlfriends mom. I feel as if it is quite scattered and cluttered. Can you fix that? Please don't change the wording.

Hello. I've been wanting to text you about this for a while, but I've had no clue what to say or how to go about this, so I guess I'll just type. Since my last discussion with you, it seems things have only gotten way worse. The last time you let Tyonna hang out with me (outside the house), was over 2 months ago, and even inside was over a month ago. I have been following your rules you've laid out, and (I presume) she has too. She turns 17 in less than a month, meaning she’s a year away from being an adult. She’s never allowed to hang out with anyone unless it’s at the house. She’s basically losing friends because she can’t hang out with anyone or do anything. She says the reason she can’t go out most of the time is because you have a headache or you just got home or something. Which makes zero sense to me, because her going somewhere does not even correlate with that. The fact that she has a bedtime of 8 (or to begin with) kind of baffles me. She’s old enough to make her own decisions and im SURE she can figure out when to go to bed. I wasn’t really gonna say anything about this because it didn't really bother me all that much, but, the fact that tink broke my phone, and I mean broke, the screen is entirely blacked out (contrary to what she might say, the phone was wayback on the bed, not on the floor, so it shouldn't have been ‘stepped on’), and you didn’t even say a word to me and even indirectly blamed it on me thru tyonna, really just shocks me. I wasn’t even really expecting a sorry, more an acknowledgement. Speaking of acknowledgement, it seems like you have no interest in getting to know me aside from small talk when I walk through the door kinda hurts. I do get it if you're not very social or whatever but whenever I'm even on the phone with her you tell her to get off the phone, even though I called her like 3 minutes prior. Tyonna is constantly crying to me about how she had to cancel the plans she had with a friend last minute because you didn’t feel like letting her go out. There is a HUGE double standard here. I know you see all her friends going out and being able to just freely go where they want and be able to do what they want (within reason), why doesn’t this apply to her? She’s just like every other kid, and she’s wasting her teenage years just rotting in the house. I'm allowed to go out everyday, but I have to be back by 8. In the summer it’s around 11. As long as I'm staying out of trouble I'm good and allowed to do whatever. It just seems like you are latching on to her. She is miserable and even talked to me about trying to move out eventually, to which you said “I'd like to see her try”. The fact that I haven’t been allowed to see my girlfriend in over a month kinda shatters me. It’s not even like she’s in trouble or anything, she just isn’t allowed out. Reminds me of mother knows best from tangled. She still complains to me about how she’s practically been parenting tink since she was born. I have never in my life seen a 6 year old threaten to stab somebody because she didn’t get her way. The last time I was over there, tink was nagging tyonna to come to her room, (which only makes sense, she's pretty young) but she does not deal with reason at ALL. I only had about 30 minutes left to hang out with her and tink threatened to stab her, put lipstick on her sheets, and she found anything she thought tyonna valued and threatened to rip it up or destroy it because she didn’t get her way. Thats absurd. She tells you about these things and you don’t intervene at all, you just tell her  to deal with it. I'm not telling you how to parent, I'm really not, but this is crazy. My friends' mothers have taken me in as one of their own, even just being friends. They are so welcoming and friendly, but this is the exact opposite. I feel like you just don’t like me maybe? I’ve tried my hardest to show that I’m influencing good decisions unto her, but everything only seems to get worse. I really just want her to be happy and to be able to see her. We are both miserable. Please, i’m begging you, try to see things from my perspective. She’s almost an adult and she can’t even go outside or make her own decisions. This really sucks. I’m so upset. I just want things to be normal.

Hello. I've been wanting to text you about this for a while, but I've been unsure about how to approach the topic. Since our last conversation, it feels like things have only gotten worse between Tyonna and me. The last time you let Tyonna hang out with me (outside the house) was over 2 months ago, and even inside was over a month ago. I have been following the rules you've laid out, and I believe she has as well.

Tyonna is turning 17 soon, which means she is just one year away from being an adult. Nevertheless, she is hardly allowed to socialize with anyone unless it’s at your house. She’s losing friends because she can’t spend time with anyone or participate in activities. Most of the time, she says she can’t go out because you have a headache or you’re tired. This doesn’t make sense to me, as her going out doesn't affect you directly. Moreover, her 8 PM bedtime seems rather strict for someone her age. I believe she is old enough to make her own decisions, including when to go to bed.

To be honest, it didn't bother me too much in the beginning. However, when my phone screen was broken by Tink, and you did not acknowledge what happened or offer consolation, I was taken aback. I wasn’t expecting an apology per se, but an acknowledgement would have been appreciated. 

Moreover, it seems like you have no interest in getting to know me beyond the small talk at the door. While I understand if you’re not very social or preoccupied with other matters, when I am on the phone with Tyonna, it is obvious that you want her to stop talking to me. 

Tyonna often cries to me about her frustrations with your strictness and double standards. She's witnessed her friends being able to go out freely, within reason, and doesn't understand why these rules don't apply to her. She feels confined in the house and fears that she's wasting her teenage years. My curfew is more lenient; I can go out daily and must be back by 8 PM. In the summer, this is extended to 11 PM. As long as I’m staying out of trouble, there are no issues.

It seems like Tyonna feels trapped, and she's even talked to me about trying to move out eventually. It's disheartening that I haven’t been allowed to see her for more than a month even though she isn’t in trouble or anything. Additionally, she’s expressed concerns about having to care for Tink since her birth. Tink can be very difficult, as evidenced by the time she threatened Tyonna when she didn't get her way - this behavior is concerning.

When Tyonna tries to talk to you about these issues, it seems like you don’t intervene and support her. While I'm not trying to tell you how to parent, this situation feels tense for me, given that my friends’ parents are so welcoming and friendly.

I'm not sure if you just don’t like me, but I've tried my hardest to show that I’m a positive influence on Tyonna. Nevertheless, things seem to be getting worse. I genuinely want her to be happy, and I want to be able to see her. We both feel miserable. Please try to see things from my perspective. She’s almost an adult and should be allowed some autonomy in her life. This situation is really troubling me, and I just want things to be better for everyone involved.

Я согласен с этим предложением. Выбор профессии имеет большое значение для будущего человека, и он должен обдумывать свои возможности и интересы, чтобы выбрать профессию, которая подходит ему лучше всего. Кроме того, работа не только определяет карьеру, но и может иметь влияние на личную жизнь человека - его расписание, доход, чувство выполненности и удовлетворенности работой. Поэтому важно принимать осознанные решения о выборе профессии и понимать, как это отразится на будущем.
нет, я имел ввиду как это предложение построено.

Данное предложение построено корректно и является грамматически правильным. Оно состоит из двух частей, разделенных союзом "и". Первая часть - "Выбор профессии влияет на будущее человека", а вторая часть - "он должен понимать: что его работа может ему дать, как его работа будет вливаться в его личную жизнь". Вторая часть может быть расширена до: "он должен понимать то, что его работа может ему дать и то, как его работа будет вливаться в его личную жизнь". conversation.content:
sprav stručné poznámky k nasledujúcemu textu:
3.2.5	Grafomotorika

Grafomotorika je súbor psychomotorických činností, ktoré jedinec vykonáva pri písaní. Je ovplyvnená úrovňou hrubej motoriky, jemnej motoriky, pohybovou koordináciou, senzomotorikou. Grafomotorika je odborný výraz pre pohyb, ktorý sprevádza písanie (I. Šalingová, 1988).
 
Rozvoj grafomotorických pohybov postupuje od ramenného kĺbu cez zápästie až po pohyby dlane a prstov, usmerňuje používanie nácvikového grafického materiálu, držanie tela i sklon a veľ- kosť plochy grafomotorického záznamu dieťaťa.
Pri diagnostike, ale aj pri rozvíjajúcich cvičeniach sa zameriavame na tri základne druhy cvi- čení. Všetky tri okruhy veľmi úzko navzájom súvisia.

POHYBOVÉ CVIČENIA
Pohybové cvičenia predstavujú prvý z troch základných okruhov odporúčaných krokov pri roz- víjaní a diagnostikovaní grafomotorických zručností detí predškolského veku.

SLUCHOVO-POHYBOVÉ A SLUCHOVÉ CVIČENIA
Druhým okruhom, ktorý plynule nadväzuje na predchádzajúci, sú sluchovo-pohybové a slu- chové cvičenia. Dieťa pomocou sluchových a sluchovo-pohybových zážitkov uskutočňuje svoje predstavy v grafických cvičeniach, v grafickom prejave. Vhodné sluchové, hudobné a rytmické pod- nety aktívne podporujú a rozvíjajú sluchové vnímanie a prostredníctvom neho, na základe vhod- nej motivácie, sa rozvíja grafický prejav dieťaťa. Charakteristické sluchové vnemy s vhodným gra- fomotorickým cvičením vedú dieťa k uvoľneniu celého tela, precvičeniu ruky, zdokonaľujú jemnú motoriku, a tak hravým a nenásilným spôsobom ho pripravujú na zvládnutie písma a písania. Je vhodné využívať nielen prvky hudobnej výchovy a rytmiky, ale aj iné podnety sluchového charak- teru, rozprávky, hádanky, zvuky hudobného a nehudobného charakteru.

POHYBOVO-SLUCHOVO-ZRAKOVÉ CVIČENIA
Tretím okruhom, ktorý plynule nadväzuje na predchádzajúce dva, sú pohybovo-sluchovo-zra- kové cvičenia.
V tejto fáze ide o zosúladenie všetkých troch zložiek. Cieľom týchto cvičení je prostredníctvom pohybového a sluchového zážitku sústrediť zrak dieťaťa na grafomotorické cvičenie, postupným uvoľnením priviesť dieťa k istejšej uvoľnenej a plynulej stope.
Pri nácviku a pri diagnostike grafomotorických zručností si treba uvedomiť:
1.	vek dieťaťa a jeho psychickú vyspelosť, technické zručnosti a návyky,
2.	individuálne, ale aj momentálne dispozície dieťaťa,
3.	emotívnu motiváciu, na základe ktorej je dieťa schopné a ochotné spolupracovať,
4.	technické podmienky na nácvik grafomotorických zručností v triede materskej školy.

Pri diagnostike a rozvíjajúcich cvičeniach sa zameriavame na:

FORMÁT
U detí mladšieho predškolského veku odporúčame zvoliť čo najväčší formát na grafické vyjadrenie sa. Platí zásada, že čím je dieťa mladšie, tým je potrebnejšia väčšia plocha. Zaraďujeme cviky na uvoľ- nenie paže, predlaktia a zápästia ruky. Grafický záznam cvikov realizujeme na veľkej ploche papiera, tabuli, maliarskych stojanoch, asfaltovej, vodnej alebo pieskovej ploche či podložke vysypanej drobným štrkom, pieskom. Odporúčame, aby deti pracovali v stoji, kľaku s odstupom od kresliacej plochy vodo- rovnej i zvislej na dĺžku ruky dieťaťa. Je veľmi dôležité, aby si dieťa neopieralo lakeť o podložku, pre- tože môže nastať deformácia grafického pohybu. Grafický pohyb by mal vychádzať z ramenného kĺbu, čo pri opretom lakti nie je možné. Deti si môžu samy zvoliť polohu. Odporúčame v tejto fáze nácvik nie- len jednou rukou, dominantnou, ale aj druhou a obidvoma rukami naraz.
U detí staršieho predškolského veku môžeme postupne zmenšovať formát, avšak menší for- mát ako A3 neodporúčame, len vo výnimočných prípadoch a na individuálnu prácu s dieťaťom. Zo zvislej polohy sa orientujeme na vodorovnú polohu s opretím ruky o podložku. V tejto fáze je dôle- žité orientovať sa na správny sed dieťaťa a správny nácvik držania kresliaceho materiálu.
 
SPRÁVNE SEDENIE
Je nevyhnutné, aby si deti v materskej škole osvojili správne sedenie tak, aby v prvom ročníku základnej školy ho mali dostatočne osvojené. Odporúčame, aby učiteľka sledovala u detí sedenie na celom sedadle, nie na jeho okraji. Nohy by mali celou svojou plochou byť na podlahe. Takáto po- loha je dostatočne stabilná. Sedenie by nemalo byť strnulé a násilné, pretože by to dieťa mohlo vy- čerpávať. Trup dieťaťa by mal byť mierne naklonený, ale hrudník by sa nemal dotýkať stola. Pred- laktia by mali byť voľne položené na písacej doske a smerovať do pravého uhla.

DRŽANIE CERUZKY, PERA A INÝCH KRESLIACICH POTRIEB
Veľmi dôležitý je ich správne uchopenie. Základom správneho uchopenia je úplná voľnosť svalstva hornej končatiny.
Ceruzku, alebo iný kresliaci materiál držia prvé tri prsty pravej ruky, palec, ukazovák, prostred- ník. Palec je mierne ohnutý a pridržiava ceruzku z pravej strany zhora. Ukazovák by mal prečnie- vať nad palcom a smerovať k hrotu. Prostredník ju pridržiava zprava prvým článkom. Posledné dva prsty sú mierne ohnuté dovnútra dlane a mierne sa dotýkajú.

GRAFICKÝ MATERIÁL
U mladších detí odporúčame voliť grafický materiál objemnejší, tak aby sa deťom dobre ucho- poval. Vhodný je materiál, ktorý zanecháva mäkkú, širšiu stopu. Odporúčame mäkké voskové bloky, tabuľové kriedy, široké pastely.
Pre deti staršieho predškolského veku postupne pridávame rôzne grafické materiály, napr. ce- ruzky 4–6 B, uhol, suchý pastel, farebný i čierny tuš, špajle, drievka, farbičky Progresso, kriedu. Ne- odporúčame na cielené grafomotorické cvičenia používať fixky, nakoľko pri kreslení s nimi dieťa nie je nútené vyvinúť primeraný tlak na podložku. Jedinú výnimku tvorí nácvik bodu, kedy je fix- ka vhodná, pretože dieťa vidí svoj výtvor dostatočne zreteľne.
Počas nácviku a diagnostike sledujeme pohybu zľava doprava, snažíme sa o stály kontakt die- ťaťa s kresliacim materiálom a plochou formátu, na ktorej sa grafická stopa zaznamenáva.

GRAFICKÉ VZORY
Na zachovanie postupnosti a primeranosti je vhodné postupovať od bodu cez horizontálne lí- nie, vertikálne línie, lomené línie, krížené línie k oblúku, oválu a kruhu. Cvičiť a diagnostikovať by sme mali jednotlivé grafické vzory v postupnosti podľa náročnosti, so zachovaným smerom, v akom sa majú kresliť. V záverečnej fáze jednotlivých cvičení nie je vhodné používať pracovné listy s pred- kreslenými vzormi a linajkami. Takýto druh pracovného listu dieťa obmedzuje, v grafických vzo- roch zanechávaná stopa býva kŕčovitá, dieťa sa sústreďuje na inú časť pracovného listu (predkres- lený vzor). Vhodné sú väčšie formáty pracovných listov, na ktorých dieťa na základe pohybového a sluchového zážitku pracuje s daným grafickým vzorom. Menšie formáty ako A4 s rôznymi vzormi, ktoré dieťa dopĺňa, odporúčame používať veľmi individuálne, keď dieťa prešlo všetkými odporúča- nými cvičeniami, keď drží grafický materiál uvoľnene a zanechávaná grafická stopa je istá a ply- nulá.
Systematické a cielené cvičenia v spojitosti pohybu, sluchu a zraku rozvíjajú grafomotorické zručnosti detí predškolského veku, zároveň posilňujú jemnú motoriku, zlepšujú psychiku dieťaťa, rozvíjajú tvorivosť a myslenie, zlepšujú priestorovú orientáciu a uľahčujú deťom začiatky písania v prvom ročníku základnej školy.

Grafomotorika je súbor psychomotorických činností, ktoré jedinec vykonáva pri písaní. Rozvoj grafomotorických pohybov postupuje od ramenného kĺbu cez zápästie až po pohyby dlane a prstov. Pri diagnostike a rozvíjajúcich cvičeniach sa zameriavame na pohybové, sluchovo-pohybové a sluchové, a pohybovo-sluchovo-zrakové cvičenia. Pri nácviku a pri diagnostike grafomotorických zručností treba uvedomiť vek dieťaťa, jeho psychickú vyspelosť, technické zručnosti a návyky, individuálne, ale aj momentálne dispozície dieťaťa, emotívnu motiváciu a technické podmienky na nácvik grafomotorických zručností v triede materskej školy. Je potrebné sledovať správne sedenie a správne nácvik držania kresliaceho materiálu. Pre nácvik a diagnostiku grafomotorických zručností sa odporúča používať lepšie mäkké voskové bloky, tabuľové kriedy, široké pastely, ceruzky 4-6B, uhol, suchý pastel, farebné a čierne tuša, špajle, drievka, farbičky Progresso, kriedu. Dieťa by malo postupne prechádzať od bodu cez horizontálne línie, vertikálne línie, lomené línie, krížené línie k oblúku, oválu a kruhu. Systematické a cielené cvičenia v spojitosti pohybu, sluchu a zraku rozvíjajú grafomotorické zručnosti detí predškolského veku, zároveň posilňujú jemnú motoriku, zlepšujú psychiku dieťaťa, rozvíjajú tvorivosť a myslenie.

U detí staršieho predškolského veku môžeme postupne zmenšovať formát, avšak menší for- mát ako A3 neodporúčame, len vo výnimočných prípadoch a na individuálnu prácu s dieťaťom. Zo zvislej polohy sa orientujeme na vodorovnú polohu s opretím ruky o podložku. V tejto fáze je dôle- žité orientovať sa na správny sed dieťaťa a správny nácvik držania kresliaceho materiálu.
 
3.2.5.5 SPRÁVNE SEDENIE
Je nevyhnutné, aby si deti v materskej škole osvojili správne sedenie tak, aby v prvom ročníku základnej školy ho mali dostatočne osvojené. Odporúčame, aby učiteľka sledovala u detí sedenie na celom sedadle, nie na jeho okraji. Nohy by mali celou svojou plochou byť na podlahe. Takáto po- loha je dostatočne stabilná. Sedenie by nemalo byť strnulé a násilné, pretože by to dieťa mohlo vy- čerpávať. Trup dieťaťa by mal byť mierne naklonený, ale hrudník by sa nemal dotýkať stola. Pred- laktia by mali byť voľne položené na písacej doske a smerovať do pravého uhla.

3.2.5.6 DRŽANIE CERUZKY, PERA A INÝCH KRESLIACICH POTRIEB
Veľmi dôležitý je ich správne uchopenie. Základom správneho uchopenia je úplná voľnosť svalstva hornej končatiny.
Ceruzku, alebo iný kresliaci materiál držia prvé tri prsty pravej ruky, palec, ukazovák, prostred- ník. Palec je mierne ohnutý a pridržiava ceruzku z pravej strany zhora. Ukazovák by mal prečnie- vať nad palcom a smerovať k hrotu. Prostredník ju pridržiava zprava prvým článkom. Posledné dva prsty sú mierne ohnuté dovnútra dlane a mierne sa dotýkajú.

3.2.5.7 GRAFICKÝ MATERIÁL
U mladších detí odporúčame voliť grafický materiál objemnejší, tak aby sa deťom dobre ucho- poval. Vhodný je materiál, ktorý zanecháva mäkkú, širšiu stopu. Odporúčame mäkké voskové bloky, tabuľové kriedy, široké pastely.
Pre deti staršieho predškolského veku postupne pridávame rôzne grafické materiály, napr. ce- ruzky 4–6 B, uhol, suchý pastel, farebný i čierny tuš, špajle, drievka, farbičky Progresso, kriedu. Ne- odporúčame na cielené grafomotorické cvičenia používať fixky, nakoľko pri kreslení s nimi dieťa nie je nútené vyvinúť primeraný tlak na podložku. Jedinú výnimku tvorí nácvik bodu, kedy je fix- ka vhodná, pretože dieťa vidí svoj výtvor dostatočne zreteľne.
Počas nácviku a diagnostike sledujeme pohybu zľava doprava, snažíme sa o stály kontakt die- ťaťa s kresliacim materiálom a plochou formátu, na ktorej sa grafická stopa zaznamenáva.

3.2.5.8 GRAFICKÉ VZORY
Na zachovanie postupnosti a primeranosti je vhodné postupovať od bodu cez horizontálne lí- nie, vertikálne línie, lomené línie, krížené línie k oblúku, oválu a kruhu. Cvičiť a diagnostikovať by sme mali jednotlivé grafické vzory v postupnosti podľa náročnosti, so zachovaným smerom, v akom sa majú kresliť. V záverečnej fáze jednotlivých cvičení nie je vhodné používať pracovné listy s pred- kreslenými vzormi a linajkami. Takýto druh pracovného listu dieťa obmedzuje, v grafických vzo- roch zanechávaná stopa býva kŕčovitá, dieťa sa sústreďuje na inú časť pracovného listu (predkres- lený vzor). Vhodné sú väčšie formáty pracovných listov, na ktorých dieťa na základe pohybového a sluchového zážitku pracuje s daným grafickým vzorom. Menšie formáty ako A4 s rôznymi vzormi, ktoré dieťa dopĺňa, odporúčame používať veľmi individuálne, keď dieťa prešlo všetkými odporúča- nými cvičeniami, keď drží grafický materiál uvoľnene a zanechávaná grafická stopa je istá a ply- nulá.
Systematické a cielené cvičenia v spojitosti pohybu, sluchu a zraku rozvíjajú grafomotorické zručnosti detí predškolského veku, zároveň posilňujú jemnú motoriku, zlepšujú psychiku dieťaťa, rozvíjajú tvorivosť a myslenie, zlepšujú priestorovú orientáciu a uľahčujú deťom začiatky písania v prvom ročníku základnej školy.

Nadpis: Grafomotorika

Grafomotorika je súbor psychomotorických činností, ktoré sú spojené s písaním a ovplyvnené úrovňou hrubej motoriky, jemnej motoriky, pohybovej koordináciou a senzomotorikou. 

Nadpis: Tri základné druhy cvičení

Pri rozvíjaní a diagnostikovaní grafomotorických zručností detí predškolského veku sa zameriavame na tri základné druhy cvičení: pohybové cvičenia, sluchovo-pohybové a sluchové cvičenia a pohybovo-sluchovo-zrakové cvičenia.

Nadpis: Cvičenia a formát

Pri nácviku a diagnostike grafomotorických zručností hrajú dôležitú úlohu formát grafických materiálov a cvičení. U detí mladšieho predškolského veku je odporúčaný maximálny formát pre grafické vyjadrenie, odporúčajú sa pohybové cvičenia na uvoľnenie paže, predlaktia a zápästia ruky. U detí staršieho predškolského veku postupne menší formát, ale odporúča sa neísť pod formát A3. 

Nadpis: Správne sedenie a držanie materiálu

Správne sedenie detí je dôležité pre ich neskôr lepšie ovládanie písma. Deti by mali sedieť tak, aby boli na podlahe celou plochou nôh, s opretím rúk na písacom stole a s mierne nakloneným trupom. Dôležité je tiež správne držanie ceruzky, pera a iných kresliacich potrieb.

Nadpis: Grafický materiál a vzory

Odporúča sa zvoliť grafický materiál, ktorý sa deti budú schopné dobre uchopiť a nevyžaduje veľký tlak na plochu. Vhodné sú mäkké voskové bloky, tabuľové kriedy, široké pastely a postupne aj iné grafické materiály. Cvičenie grafických vzorov by malo prebiehať systematicky a cielene, v postupnosti od bodu cez horizontálne, vertikálne a lomené až po oblúk, ovál a kruh. Na záver sa neodporúčajú pracovné listy s predkreslenými vzormi, ktoré obmedzujú dieťa a neumožňujú mu rozvíjať jeho tvorivosť. 

Nadpis: Význam cvičení pre deti predškolského veku

Cvičenie grafomotorických zručností pomáha rozvíjať jemnú motoriku, psychiku dieť

Summarize this: Skip to main content
The Verge homepage

Menu

Menu
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE/TECH
OpenAI’s CEO confirms the company isn’t training GPT-5 and ‘won’t for some time’ / CEO Sam Altman quashed rumors that OpenAI is already developing GPT-5. However, the comments likely won’t be of much consolation to those worried about AI safety.
By JAMES VINCENT

Apr 14, 2023, 12:28 PM GMT6 Comments / 6 New
Share this story



If you buy something from a Verge link, Vox Media may earn a commission. See our ethics statement.

An image of OpenAI’s logo, which looks like a stylized and symmetrical braid.
Image: OpenAI
In a discussion about threats posed by AI systems, Sam Altman, OpenAI’s CEO and co-founder, has confirmed that the company is not currently training GPT-5, the presumed successor to its AI language model GPT-4, released this March.

Speaking at an event at MIT, Altman was asked about a recent open letter circulated among the tech world that requested that labs like OpenAI pause development of AI systems “more powerful than GPT-4.” The letter highlighted concerns about the safety of future systems but has been criticized by many in the industry, including a number of signatories. Experts disagree about the nature of the threat posed by AI (is it existential or more mundane?) as well as how the industry might go about “pausing” development in the first place.

At MIT, Altman said the letter was “missing most technical nuance about where we need the pause” and noted that an earlier version claimed that OpenAI is currently training GPT-5. “We are not and won’t for some time,” said Altman. “So in that sense it was sort of silly.”

However, just because OpenAI is not working on GPT-5 doesn’t mean it’s not expanding the capabilities of GPT-4 — or, as Altman was keen to stress, considering the safety implications of such work. “We are doing other things on top of GPT-4 that I think have all sorts of safety issues that are important to address and were totally left out of the letter,” he said.

You can watch a video of the exchange below:

GPT hype and the fallacy of version numbers
Altman’s comments are interesting — though not necessarily because of what they reveal about OpenAI’s future plans. Instead, they highlight a significant challenge in the debate about AI safety: the difficulty of measuring and tracking progress. Altman may say that OpenAI is not currently training GPT-5, but that’s not a particularly meaningful statement.

Some of the confusion can be attributed to what I call the fallacy of version numbers: the idea that numbered tech updates reflect definite and linear improvements in capability. It’s a misconception that’s been nurtured in the world of consumer tech for years, where numbers assigned to new phones or operating systems aspire to the rigor of version control but are really just marketing tools. “Well of course the iPhone 35 is better than the iPhone 34,” goes the logic of this system. “The number is bigger ipso facto the phone is better.”

Because of the overlap between the worlds of consumer tech and artificial intelligence, this same logic is now often applied to systems like OpenAI’s language models. This is true not only of the sort of hucksters who post hyperbolic ?? Twitter threads ?? predicting that superintelligent AI will be here in a matter of years because the numbers keep getting bigger but also of more informed and sophisticated commentators. As a lot of claims made about AI superintelligence are essentially unfalsifiable, these individuals rely on similar rhetoric to get their point across. They draw vague graphs with axes labeled “progress” and “time,” plot a line going up and to the right, and present this uncritically as evidence.

This is not to dismiss fears about AI safety or ignore the fact that these systems are rapidly improving and not fully under our control. But it is to say that there are good arguments and bad arguments, and just because we’ve given a number to something — be that a new phone or the concept of intelligence — doesn’t mean we have the full measure of it.

Instead, I think the focus in these discussions should be on capabilities: on demonstrations of what these systems can and can’t do and predictions of how this may change over time.

That’s why Altman’s confirmation that OpenAI is not currently developing GPT-5 won’t be of any consolation to people worried about AI safety. The company is still expanding the potential of GPT-4 (by connecting it to the internet, for example), and others in the industry are building similarly ambitious tools, letting AI systems act on behalf of users. There’s also all sorts of work that is no doubt being done to optimize GPT-4, and OpenAI may release GPT-4.5 (as it did GPT-3.5) first — another way that version numbers can mislead.

Even if the world’s governments were somehow able to enforce a ban on new AI developments, it’s clear that society has its hands full with the systems currently available. Sure, GPT-5 isn’t coming yet, but does it matter when GPT-4 is still not fully understood?

К булевым функциям сохраняющим константу 1, относят такие булевы функции f(x1,...,xn), для которых справедливо соотношение f(1,...,1)=1.
Примерами булевых функций, сохраняющих константу 1, являются функции f1, f3, f5, f7, f9, f11, f13, f15 (табл. 1.1). Поскольку таблица истинности для функций, сохраняющих константу 1, в последней строке значений функций содержит 1, то имеется ровно 22(^n)-1 таких функций.

К самодвойственным булевым функциям относят такие булевы функции, которые двойственны по отнощению к самим себе, т.е. справедливо соотношение f(x1,...,xn)= (f(x1,..., xn)). Краткий конспект:

1. Булевы функции, сохраняющие константу 0, равны 0 на нулевых наборах значений.

6. Самодвойственные булевы функции - f3, f5, f10, f12.
7. Количество самодвойственных функций равно 2^(n)/2.

К линейным булевым функциям относят такие булевы функции, которые представимы в виде
f(x1,...,xn)=с0 + c1x1 + ... + cnxn,
где ci E {0,1}, а + операция "сумма по mod 2".

Линейными являются булевы функции f0, f3, f5, f6, f9, f10, f12, f15, (табл. 1.1), ибо 
f0 = 0, f3 = x1, f5 = x2, f6 = x1 + x2, f9 = x1 + x2 + 1, f10 = /x2 = 1 + x2, f12 = /x1 = 1 + x1, f15 = 1.

Краткий конспект:

1. Линейные булевы функции - это функции, представимые в виде суммы переменных, где коэффициенты равны 0 или 1, а операция сложения выполняется по модулю 2.
2. Примеры линейных функций - f0, f3, f5, f6, f9, f10, f12, f15.
3. Функции f3, f5, f6, f9, f10, f12 являются одновременно линейными и самодвойственными.
4. Линейные функции часто используются в криптографии для шифрования.

Поскольку линейная функция однозначно определяется заданием коэффициентов с0,..., сn, то число линейных функций равно 2(n+1). 
 Прежде чем ввести понятие класса монотонных булевых функций, дадим следующее определение. 
Двоичный набор Y = (y1,y2,...,yn) не меньше двоичного набора B = (b1,b2,...,bn), если для каждой пары (Yi,Bi) ,i = 1...n справедливо соотношение Yi⟹ Bi.
Так, набор 1011 >= 1010. Вместе с тем наборы 1011 и 0100 несравнимы в том смысле, что для них не выполняется ни соотношение Y ⟹B, ни Y  B. 

Булева функция f(x1,...,xn) называется монотонной, если для любых двух наборов Y = <y1,y2,...,yn> и B = <b1,b2,...,bn> таких, что Y >= B имеет место неравенство f(y1,...,yn)>=f(b1,...,bn).

Монотонными являются булевы функции f0, f1, f3, f5, f7, f15 (табл. 1.1). Вместе с тем функция f2 из табл. 1.1 не является монотонной, так как f2(1,0) > f2(1,1), хотя набор {1,0} меньше, чем набор {1,1}.

Краткий конспект:

1. Линейных булевых функций с n переменными существует 2^(n+1).
2. Булева функция f(x1,...,xn) называется монотонной, если при увеличении значений переменных на один и тот же бит результат функции не уменьшается.
3. Примеры монотонных функций - f0, f1, f3, f5, f7, f15.
4. Монотонность связана с возрастанием функции по каждому аргументу.
5. Функция f2 из таблицы 1.1 не является монотонной, так как на одном наборе изменив значение одной переменной на 1, значение функции уменьшилось.
6. Монотонные функции также широко применяются в криптографии и теории кодирования.

Поскольку линейная функция однозначно определяется заданием коэффициентов с0,..., сn, то число линейных функций равно 2(n+1). 
 Прежде чем ввести понятие класса монотонных булевых функций, дадим следующее определение. 
Двоичный набор Y = (y1,y2,...,yn) не меньше двоичного набора B = (b1,b2,...,bn), если для каждой пары (Yi,Bi) ,i = 1...n справедливо соотношение Yi⟹ Bi.
Так, набор 1011 >= 1010. Вместе с тем наборы 1011 и 0100 несравнимы в том смысле, что для них не выполняется ни соотношение Y ⟹B, ни Y  B. 

Булева функция f(x1,...,xn) называется монотонной, если для любых двух наборов Y = <y1,y2,...,yn> и B = <b1,b2,...,bn> таких, что Y >= B имеет место неравенство f(y1,...,yn)>=f(b1,...,bn).

Монотонными являются булевы функции f0, f1, f3, f5, f7, f15 (табл. 1.1). Вместе с тем функция f2 из табл. 1.1 не является монотонной, так как f2(1,0) > f2(1,1), хотя набор {1,0} меньше, чем набор {1,1}.

而后实施的《网络安全等级保护安全设计技术要求》（GB/T25070-2019）中明确规定二级及以上的定级系统需要设置安全管理中心。此外《关键信息基础设施网络安全保护基本要求》明确运营者要建立监测预警制度，对所有监测信息进行整合分析，以便及时关联、分析关键信息基础设施的网络安全态势。
随着智慧地铁的不断发展以及数字化转型要求的不断深化，在各专业系统互联互通的需求下网络的边界日趋模糊，越来越多的网络安全隐患被带入生产系统的工控网络中，对工业控制网络和系统的攻击，对企业的影响不止是经济损失还可能会产生人员伤亡，更会引发不良的社会影响。而近年已发现有轨交运营单位的系统遭受过挖矿病毒和勒索病毒的攻击，病毒攻击均在造成一定影响后才由运维人员发现并上报，欠缺自动化预警和及时阻断的能力。

Please rewrite the following to be concise and descriptive without going over 250 words.

When I was just starting elementary school, my father decided to get a family dog. After a long drive across the state, we finally got to meet and choose which puppy we would take home in a few weeks. Two of the tiniest, cutest miniature schnauzer puppies were looking up at me with the softest eyes you could imagine. One took a liking to me right away. He was smaller than his brother and his white fur was tinged beige, unlike his brothers much cleaner white fur.  He followed me around and we played a bit, but the fun had to end eventually. Just as soon as I had said hello to the dogs, it was time to say goodbye. As I waved goodbye to my new friend, I heard my parents pick out the larger, whiter dog. Needless to say, I cried a lot on the way home. As time passed, the sadness faded and I began to think of the dogs less and less. By the day my parents had to go pick up our new dog, I had almost forgotten about both. When my parents returned with the new dog, Teddy, I was reminded of the puppy I had befriended weeks before. Teddy did not let me be sad for long though. His puppy energy was contagious and before long we were taking turns chasing each other every day. Teddy and me became quick pals, and we stuck together for the next 12 years.

As a young child, my family went on a journey to choose a puppy for our household. Among many other adorable puppies, two miniature schnauzer puppies stood out to me. After playing with them, I formed a bond with one of the smaller puppies whose fur was tinged beige instead of white. However, my parents ended up selecting the larger, whiter puppy, causing me to feel sad on the way home. Eventually, I forgot about the puppies until my parents arrived home with our new dog, Teddy. Despite my initial sadness, Teddy's exuberant personality quickly won me over and we became close friends for the following 12 years.

conversation.content:
Summarize and rewrite all paragraphs into one in 300 words, "How can AI help businesses? 
Horizontal 

Advertising 

Audience Targeting: AI algorithms can analyze large amounts of data, such as browsing history, search queries, and social media activity, to identify patterns and create audience segments. This helps advertisers to target their ads more effectively, reaching the right people with the right message at the right time.
Ad Placement: AI algorithms can analyze website content, user behavior, and other factors to determine the best placement for ads. This helps advertisers to reach their target audience in the most effective way possible.
Ad Creative: AI algorithms can analyze data on what ad creative works best for different audiences, allowing advertisers to create more effective ads. This includes analyzing images, video, and text to determine what resonates with different groups of people.
Bid Management: AI-powered bid management platforms can optimize ad spend by adjusting bids in real-time based on factors such as ad performance and competitor activity. This helps to improve the ROI of advertising campaigns.
Predictive Analytics: AI algorithms can predict which ads are likely to be most effective, based on historical data and other factors. This helps advertisers to allocate their ad spend more effectively, maximizing the ROI of their advertising campaigns.

Example: Our team created a cutting-edge recommendation system for the e-commerce website of a major retail chain. The system optimized brand advertisements and personalized loyalty offers by utilizing the recommendation engine. As a result, the recommender system generated an impressive impact of $300 million in additional revenue through product page recommendations.

2) Agritech

AI has several applications in the agritech industry, including:
Precision agriculture: AI can analyze data collected from sensors, drones, and satellites to optimize planting, irrigation, and fertilization, resulting in higher yields and reduced costs.
Crop management: AI can help farmers monitor crop health, detect diseases, and pests early, and identify nutrient deficiencies, enabling targeted interventions.
Predictive analytics: AI can analyze historical data on weather, soil, and crop performance to predict future yields, identify optimal planting times, and optimize harvest schedules.
Livestock management: AI can monitor animal behavior and health, detect illnesses early, and predict animal growth rates, enabling farmers to improve animal welfare and increase productivity.
Supply chain optimization: AI can optimize transportation routes, manage inventory, and predict demand, reducing waste and ensuring timely delivery of fresh produce.
3) Aviation

Flight operations: AI can assist in optimizing flight paths, reducing fuel consumption, and improving on-time performance by analyzing real-time data on weather, airspace congestion, and airport capacity.
Maintenance: AI can help airlines monitor and predict equipment failures, reducing downtime and increasing safety.
Passenger experience: AI can personalize the passenger experience by recommending amenities, services, and entertainment based on traveler preferences.
Safety and security: AI can help airlines identify potential security threats, monitor aircraft performance, and identify potential maintenance issues before they become critical.
Air traffic management: AI can help air traffic controllers manage congestion, reduce delays, and improve safety by analyzing real-time data on weather, aircraft location, and airspace congestion.
4) BFSI

Fraud Detection: AI algorithms can detect fraudulent transactions and identify patterns that are indicative of fraud. This can help banks and financial institutions to prevent financial loss and protect their customers' assets.
Risk Management: AI models can predict potential risks associated with financial investments and suggest ways to minimize risk. This can help investors to make more informed decisions and reduce their exposure to financial risk.
Customer Service: Chatbots and virtual assistants powered by AI can provide personalized customer service, 24/7, and can answer customer queries in real-time, improving customer satisfaction.
Process Automation: AI can automate several routine tasks such as loan processing, underwriting, and document verification. This not only saves time but also reduces errors and increases efficiency.
Personalized Marketing: AI algorithms can analyze customer data to identify patterns and preferences, enabling personalized marketing campaigns that are more likely to resonate with the customer and lead to higher conversions.
5) Education
Personalized Learning: AI algorithms can analyze student data and provide personalized learning experiences based on individual learning styles, preferences, and progress. This can help students to learn at their own pace, which can lead to better learning outcomes.
Adaptive Assessments: AI can be used to create adaptive assessments that adjust the difficulty level of questions based on the student's ability. This can provide a more accurate measure of a student's knowledge and skills, leading to better evaluation and assessment.
Virtual Tutors: AI-powered virtual tutors can provide personalized guidance to students, answering questions and providing feedback on their work. This can help to reinforce learning, improve student engagement, and reduce the workload of teachers.
Automated Grading: AI can automate grading of objective-based assessments, such as multiple-choice questions, saving teachers' time and reducing grading errors.
Predictive Analytics: AI can analyze student data to predict which students are at risk of falling behind and need additional support. This can enable early intervention, allowing teachers to provide personalized support to struggling students.

Example: Our team developed a Q&A bot capable of answering educational inquiries and generating descriptive and multiple-choice questions, along with relevant images sourced from the course textbook. Additionally, we designed an AI-powered dashboard that allows students to easily solve their queries and permits teachers to generate automated tests. The platform offers various question types, including fill-in-the-blank, multiple-choice, and descriptive questions. Over 130,000 students have been equipped with our solution, which delivers responses within a second.

6) Entertainment

Personalized Recommendations: AI algorithms are being used by streaming services like Netflix and Spotify to analyze user data and recommend content that matches their preferences. This not only helps users discover new content but also keeps them engaged and subscribed to the service.
Content Creation: AI is being used to create new forms of content such as music, art, and even movies. For instance, AI-powered music composition tools like Amper Music can generate original tracks in various genres and moods. Similarly, the AI-generated artwork is being used by galleries and museums worldwide.
Virtual Assistants: AI-powered virtual assistants like Siri and Alexa are becoming increasingly popular in the entertainment industry. These assistants can help users find information about their favorite movies, songs, and artists, and even play content on demand.
Gaming: AI is being used to enhance gaming experiences by creating more intelligent and challenging opponents, generating personalized game content, and improving the game's overall performance.

7) Healthcare

Medical Imaging: AI is being used to analyze medical images such as X-rays, MRIs, and CT scans. AI algorithms can detect patterns and anomalies in images that may be difficult for human radiologists to identify, leading to more accurate and faster diagnosis.
Personalized Treatment: AI algorithms can analyze large amounts of patient data to identify patterns and develop personalized treatment plans. This can lead to more effective treatments and better outcomes for patients.
Drug Discovery: AI is being used to analyze vast amounts of data to identify potential drug candidates. This can significantly reduce the time and cost of drug development.
Virtual Nursing Assistants: AI-powered virtual nursing assistants can provide patients with personalized health coaching, monitor their vital signs, and remind them to take their medication.
Administrative Tasks: AI-powered tools can automate administrative tasks such as appointment scheduling, billing, and patient record management. This can save time for healthcare providers and improve operational efficiency.

Example: We have developed an AI-based predictive model by utilizing 9 years of data from diverse medical events. This state-of-the-art model allows us to anticipate cancer drug prescriptions for specific months in advance. As a result, we have positively impacted 45 million patients, achieved a remarkable accuracy rate of 91%, and generated an incremental revenue of $100 million

8) Hospitality

Personalization: AI-powered systems can analyze guest data to understand their preferences and behavior, allowing hotels and resorts to tailor their services and offerings to each individual guest.
Chatbots: AI-powered chatbots can be used for customer service and support, helping guests with everything from booking a room to ordering room service.
Revenue management: AI can be used to analyze data on room rates, occupancy levels, and demand patterns to optimize pricing and maximize revenue.
Operational efficiency: AI can help streamline operations by automating tasks such as room cleaning schedules, inventory management, and maintenance requests.
Security: AI can be used to enhance security and safety in hotels by analyzing surveillance footage, detecting anomalies, and alerting staff to potential issues.
Marketing and advertising: AI can be used to analyze customer data and behavior to create more effective marketing and advertising campaigns.

Example: One of the largest multinational chemical companies enlisted our help to create an automated email query resolution system. Our solution involved retrieving key information, such as product name and invoice ID, from customer emails and generating automatic replies by accessing the relevant document from the backend database. As a result, we were able to provide 13,000 product specifications in 55% of the email responses.

9) Human Resources

Recruitment: AI can help automate resume screening, identify potential candidates, and even conduct initial interviews through chatbots.
Candidate matching: AI can analyze candidate profiles and job requirements to match the best-fit candidates for the job.
Employee engagement: AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants can provide real-time support to employees, helping to increase engagement and productivity.
Performance management: AI can assist in setting performance goals, providing real-time feedback, and identifying areas for improvement.
Diversity and inclusion: AI can help eliminate bias by analyzing data and identifying patterns to ensure that HR policies and practices are inclusive and equitable.
Training and development: AI can provide personalized training and development plans based on employee performance data and learning preferences.

10) Manufacturing

Predictive maintenance: AI can analyze data from sensors and other equipment to identify potential equipment failures before they occur, allowing manufacturers to perform maintenance proactively and reduce downtime.
Quality control: AI can identify defects in real-time using computer vision and other technologies, enabling manufacturers to quickly identify and address quality issues.
Supply chain management: AI can optimize the supply chain by predicting demand, identifying potential bottlenecks, and optimizing transportation and logistics.
Autonomous vehicles: AI can be used to develop and control autonomous vehicles for material handling, reducing the need for human labor and increasing efficiency.
Process optimization: AI can analyze production data to optimize processes and reduce waste, resulting in increased efficiency and cost savings.
Product design: AI can assist in product design by analyzing customer feedback and usage data to identify areas for improvement and optimization.

Example: Our state-of-the-art computer vision application, built using deep learning, enables us to efficiently detect defects in gas turbines. By leveraging quality control analytics, we can ensure accurate and reliable defect detection.

11) Retail and Eccomerce

Personalization: AI can analyze customer data to provide personalized recommendations, offers, and marketing messages, improving customer experience and loyalty.
Demand forecasting: AI can predict customer demand for products, allowing retailers to optimize inventory levels, reduce stock-outs, and minimize waste.
Pricing optimization: AI can analyze market data and customer behavior to optimize pricing strategies and increase revenue.
Chatbots: AI-powered chatbots can provide customer service and support 24/7, improving customer satisfaction and reducing customer service costs.
Visual search: AI can enable customers to search for products using images, improving search accuracy and making the shopping experience more intuitive.
Fraud prevention: AI can help prevent fraud by analyzing transaction data and identifying suspicious patterns.

Example: We developed an AI-based web application that enables users to automatically generate banners for their offers without the need for specialized software. Users can input criteria such as food, discounts, calls-to-action, and more, and choose from 3-4 banner images. With just one click, multiple banner sizes can be created, resulting in faster campaign executions at lower costs. Our solution generated 10,000 banners per week.

Vertical

Logistics

Predictive Analytics: AI algorithms can analyze historical data to predict future demand, supply chain disruptions, and transportation delays. This can help logistics companies optimize their operations, reduce costs, and improve customer satisfaction.
Route Optimization: AI-powered routing software can optimize delivery routes, taking into account factors such as traffic, weather, and vehicle capacity. This can reduce transportation costs and improve delivery times.
Inventory Management: AI algorithms can analyze inventory data to optimize stocking levels, reduce waste, and prevent stockouts. This can help logistics companies reduce inventory carrying costs and improve customer satisfaction.
Warehouse Automation: AI-powered robots can automate warehouse operations, such as picking and packing, reducing labor costs, and increasing efficiency.
Last-Mile Delivery: AI-powered drones and autonomous vehicles can deliver packages to customers in urban areas, reducing transportation costs and improving delivery times.


Example: With an automated information extraction system, logistics companies can convert any document into structured data within seconds.

2) Inspection and Defect Detection

Image Recognition: AI algorithms can analyze images captured during the manufacturing process to identify any defects in the products. The system can be trained to recognize patterns that indicate defects, such as cracks, scratches, or discoloration.
Sensor Analytics: Sensors installed in the manufacturing process can collect data about various parameters, such as temperature, pressure, and vibration. AI algorithms can analyze this data to identify any anomalies that may indicate defects in the process.
Predictive Maintenance: AI can be used to predict when equipment is likely to fail, based on data collected from sensors and other sources. This can help prevent defects from occurring due to equipment malfunction.
Quality Control: AI algorithms can be used to automate the quality control process by analyzing data collected from sensors and cameras. This can help identify defects early on and prevent defective products from leaving the manufacturing process.
Natural Language Processing (NLP): AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants can be used to communicate with employees and customers to identify any issues or defects in the manufacturing process. NLP algorithms can analyze the text and provide insights into potential defects.

Example: With artificial intelligence, we evaluate the quality of rice from models designed to detect any broken or damaged grains.

3) Customer Success

Customer data analysis: AI can analyze customer data to identify patterns, anticipate customer needs and preferences, and help customer success teams deliver personalized solutions.
Chatbots: AI-powered chatbots can provide customers with real-time support, reducing response times and improving customer satisfaction.
Predictive analytics: AI can help customer success teams predict which customers are at risk of churn and provide proactive outreach to retain them.
Automated workflows: AI can automate routine tasks such as data entry, freeing up customer success teams to focus on strategic tasks that require human judgment and creativity.
Knowledge management: AI can help customer success teams manage and curate knowledge bases, making it easier for agents to find and provide accurate and timely solutions.

4) Image and Video Analytics

Object detection: AI can identify and locate specific objects in images and videos, enabling automatic tagging and categorization of visual content.
Facial recognition: AI can analyze images and videos to identify and recognize individuals, enabling applications such as security, attendance tracking, and personalized advertising.
Image and video classification: AI can categorize images and videos based on their content, enabling applications such as content moderation, recommendation systems, and search.
Scene recognition: AI can analyze images and videos to recognize the type of environment they depict, enabling applications such as autonomous driving, surveillance, and robotics.
Action recognition: AI can analyze videos to identify specific actions and activities, enabling applications such as sports analytics, video surveillance, and human behavior analysis.
Content creation: AI can generate images and videos based on text descriptions, enabling applications such as personalized video ads and virtual reality environments.

Example: Our team created a brand compliance tracking dashboard for a client with 4,500 dealerships. The dashboard uses AI algorithms to sort and compare batches of captured images, generating actionable insights through an intuitive graphical interface. With accuracy exceeding 90%, the dashboard is currently deployed across over 1,000 showrooms, where it performs 18 different compliance checks.

5) Sales and Marketing

Predictive Analytics: AI algorithms can analyze large amounts of data to identify patterns and predict future outcomes. This can help sales and marketing teams make informed decisions and develop effective strategies to drive revenue.
Lead Scoring and Qualification: AI-powered tools can analyze customer data and behavior to score leads and qualify them based on their likelihood to make a purchase. This helps sales teams prioritize their efforts and focus on the most promising leads.
Chatbots and Virtual Assistants: AI-powered chatbots and virtual assistants can provide 24/7 customer support and assistance, improving customer experience and reducing the workload on human agents.
Content Creation and Optimization: AI can analyze customer data and preferences to create personalized content and optimize it for maximum engagement. This can help improve brand awareness and customer loyalty.
Sales Forecasting: AI algorithms can analyze historical data and market trends to forecast future sales, helping sales teams plan and allocate resources more effectively.

Example: Our team created a sales intelligence platform for a pharmaceutical company that utilizes AI technology. This platform resulted in a 23% increase in conversion rates and enabled sales representatives to effectively target physicians, leading to an increase in brand awareness and sales.

6)  Learning and Development

1) Personalized Learning: AI algorithms can analyze student data and behavior to provide personalized learning experiences. This can help students learn at their own pace, focus on areas where they need improvement, and stay engaged with the material.

2) Adaptive Assessments: AI-powered assessments can adapt to a student's level of knowledge and skill, providing a more accurate measurement of their progress and understanding.

3) Intelligent Tutoring Systems: AI-powered tutoring systems can provide students with personalized feedback and guidance, helping them to master new skills and concepts more effectively.

4) Automated Grading: AI algorithms can automatically grade assignments and provide instant feedback to students, saving time for instructors and improving the efficiency of the learning process.

5) Learning Analytics: AI can analyze large amounts of student data to identify patterns and trends, providing insights that can inform teaching strategies and curriculum development."

AI algorithms can significantly benefit businesses in various industries, such as advertising, agritech, aviation, BFSI, education, entertainment, healthcare, hospitality, human resources, manufacturing, retail and e-commerce, and logistics. It can help with audience targeting, ad placement, ad creative, bid management, and predictive analytics. In agritech, AI applications include precision agriculture, crop management, predictive analytics, livestock management, and supply chain optimization. The aviation industry can use AI for flight operations, maintenance, passenger experience, safety and security, and air traffic management. In BFSI, AI can help with fraud detection, risk management, customer service, process automation, and personalized marketing.

Education can benefit from personalized learning, adaptive assessments, virtual tutors, automated grading, and predictive analytics using AI. The entertainment industry can utilize AI for personalized recommendations, content creation, virtual assistants, and gaming. Healthcare can use AI for medical imaging, personalized treatment, drug discovery, virtual nursing assistants, and administrative tasks. The hospitality industry can use AI for personalization, chatbots, revenue management, operational efficiency, security, and marketing and advertising.

Human resources can use AI in recruitment, candidate matching, employee engagement, performance management, diversity and inclusion, and training and development. Manufacturing can use AI for predictive maintenance, quality control, supply chain management, autonomous vehicles, process optimization, and product design. Retail and e-commerce businesses can use AI for personalization, demand forecasting, pricing optimization, chatbots, visual search, and fraud prevention.

Vertical industries, such as logistics, can use AI for predictive analytics, route optimization, inventory management, warehouse automation, and last-mile delivery. Inspection and defect detection can benefit from AI-powered image recognition, sensor analytics, predictive maintenance, and quality control. Customer success teams can use AI for customer data analysis, chatbots, predictive analytics, automated workflows, and knowledge management. AI can also be utilized for image and video analytics, sales and marketing, and learning and development.

Rewrite and summarize all paragraphs into one with all the important statistics in the passage in 300 words, "Artificial intelligence is taking over the business world. McKinsey’s ‘The state of AI in 2020’ report estimates that 50% of companies already use AI in at least one function.

And that only scratches the surface of what’s to come. Forecasts suggest that the revenues generated by artificial intelligence will double between 2020 and 2024, signaling how many businesses will harness the technology in the name of growth.

That said, companies still struggle to adopt AI — and today, we’ll share the ten challenges we hear about the most.

Let’s dive in.

10 Challenges to AI Adoption
If you’re considering using AI in your company, it can pay to be aware of the obstacles you might face. That way, you can smooth the path to AI adoption.

These are the most common challenges out there.

1. Your company doesn’t understand the need for AI
Inertia is a powerful force. After all, if a company is doing well, teams often feel reluctant to take a risk by making a significant change.

And adopting new technology, like artificial intelligence, will feel like a major shift. Next up, there’s the challenge of convincing stakeholders to invest in a solution for which the returns can be somewhat unclear. 

Because, where AI is concerned, you won’t always know what you’re building until you’ve made a start, which is another tricky obstacle to overcome.

2. Your company lacks the appropriate data
The only way to build and train effective AI is with a sufficient amount of high-quality data. And the better the data, the better the outcomes.

But a lack of stakeholder buy-in can cause companies to underinvest in the data management systems required to enable AI, leaving them unable to train an algorithm on how to solve their business problems accurately.

That said — if your company uses a CRM tool to collect customer demographics, purchase behavior, or on-site interactions, you may have a data set you can use. And where there are gaps, online data libraries, even synthetic data, can often fill them. 

But if your company isn’t interested in AI in principle, then you won’t know what data you need, let alone how to structure it.

3. Your company lacks the skill sets
Data is only half the equation. You need the right skill sets to make AI work. 

Yet many companies struggle to hire data and machine learning specialists, leaving them unable to take ambitions further.

And even where companies have a degree of in-house expertise, a lack of experience in the right fields can hinder progress; it can even affect hiring, as departments won’t know which roles to fill or how to assess candidates.

In some circumstances, heads of departments are simply underqualified to lead an AI implementation, resulting in inefficient processes, integration issues, or ongoing manual work that undermines the solution’s value.

4. Your company struggles to find good vendors to work with
Despite its growth, AI adoption in most businesses remains modest. 

One reason for this is many organizations have worked with AI agencies that don’t truly understand how to use the technology to deliver business value.

As a result, many companies have had negative experiences when dipping their toes in AI development, making them reluctant to dive in. Whereas had they worked with reputable and experienced AI vendors at the outset, the results would speak for themselves.

Better still, had the vendors offered to tackle a small business problem first, proving the value of AI, the stakeholders would have found it easier to embrace more ambitious plans later on.

5. Your company can’t find an appropriate use case
Some organizations think that by implementing AI just for the sake of it, they will encourage company-wide adoption.

Sadly, this strategy often has the opposite effect.

When a company doesn’t have a solid use case, it’ll struggle to create a solution that delivers business value. As a result, there’ll be no way to prove that artificial intelligence can solve everyday challenges.

In all likelihood, the strategy will only reinforce the indifference felt towards the technology, so it’s best to delay adopting AI until you know how you’ll use it.

6. An AI team fails to explain how a solution works
In our experience, people will only trust a computer model if they understand how it works. And if an AI team can’t offer an explanation, implementations can end there.

The challenge only grows in situations where a model’s output contradicts a stakeholder’s thinking — because stakeholders always want to know why a decision is wrong (and why they should consider changing their mind).

Let’s put this in a medical context for clarity. Suppose a doctor diagnoses a patient, only for an algorithm to disagree. 

The doctor will need to know the logic behind the machine’s thinking before they can sign off on the alternate diagnosis (say, by seeing that a model used symptoms like sneezing and headaches to diagnose flu, not characteristics like a patient’s age or weight).

But offering transparency isn’t always simple as ‘black box’ models often spit out a prediction without a rationale.

Leaving stakeholders without a way to validate the output.

7. Different AI teams fail to work as a unit
In large companies, AI teams often end up working in silos, meaning that while they use the same technologies, they do so in isolation.

As a result, they build different infrastructures and adopt different workflows, which only complicates broader AI adoption. You can avoid this by using a ‘hub-and-spoke’ structure, whereby one central unit aligns all teams around a standardized approach.

That way, any investment in AI benefits the whole organization and brings economies of scale as you roll solutions out.

8. Management fears having to overhaul legacy systems
It’s astonishing how many organizations still rely on outdated infrastructure, applications, and devices to power their IT operations. And management often chooses not to adopt AI for fear of the costs of upgrading these systems.

But the truth is: cloud computing means you can deploy AI without overhauling an antiquated IT network, using ‘Data Lake’ functions in hybrid environments. Doing so might require your company to have an operational framework on-premises.

But you still get to benefit from more effective, AI-driven operations.

9. Some solutions are just too complex to integrate
Even if you manage to design a ground-breaking AI solution, there’s no guarantee your company will adopt it.

That’s something Netflix discovered, at a great cost, in 2009.

The streaming giant offered a one-million-dollar prize to any developer that could increase the accuracy of its recommendation engine. And while one team managed to optimize it by some 10%, Netflix never integrated the upgrade. Why so?

They said it required too much engineering effort, and so: complexity meant the solution never saw the light of day.

10. Regulation often proves the biggest hurdle of all
Suppose you want to build a cloud-based banking platform in Poland: owing to regulations, that would only be possible if your data centers are in Poland too.

Many AI projects face requirements like these. And in industries like finance, they often halt solutions in their tracks. The same can be said of the question of accountability — that is, of who should take responsibility when AI makes a mistake.

Let’s return to the medical context for an example.

Suppose a doctor changes their diagnosis based on a machine’s recommendation, only for the machine to be wrong. Is the practitioner to blame? Or is it down to the algorithm’s developer?

These are ethical questions that regulators are yet to answer. Then, there’s the question of data management.

When you build an AI solution, you need to collect vast quantities of data and, whether that data is sensitive or not, you need to keep it adequately secure. Fail to do so, and regulations mean your company could face a significant fine.

Therein lies a risk that many organizations would rather not take.

No challenge is too great
While the challenges to AI adoption are many, you should have every confidence that you can implement artificial intelligence in your company.

Truth be told: an awareness of the pitfalls is a crucial first step. 

After all, if you know the obstacles you might face, you’ll be all the more prepared to design a strategy that maximizes your chances of success. There’s no hiding that successful AI adoption relies on investment, stakeholder support, and robust workflows.

But the potential benefits are huge, and no challenge is too great to overcome."

Artificial intelligence (AI) is transforming businesses, with 50% of companies adopting AI in some capacity. AI revenues are projected to double from 2020 to 2024. However, businesses still face challenges in AI adoption, including understanding the need for AI, accessing sufficient high-quality data, building the required skill sets, working with reliable vendors, finding appropriate use cases, and explaining AI solutions to stakeholders. Additional challenges include integrating AI teams, overcoming fears of overhauling legacy systems, balancing solution complexity, and navigating regulatory hurdles.

Despite the numerous challenges, businesses can successfully implement AI through stakeholder support, investment, and robust workflows. Gaining insights into these challenges is essential for designing effective AI adoption strategies. Companies must be prepared to face these pitfalls and harness AI's potential benefits for growth, ensuring no challenge becomes too great to conquer.

conversation.content:
Make a resume of that text in French: 
Chantal a raccroché et a repris sa télécarte. La mère de Michel ne savait pas qu'on avait remercié son fils. « Je doute fort qu'on l'ait remercié, on l'a tout simplement mis à la porte », a dit Yvonne. Elle faisait de l'esprit alors que Chantal vivait un vrai drame.
Ce qui la tracassait ce n'était pas tellement le fait que Michel ait été licencié, mais qu'une fois de plus il n'ait été capable de rien. Yvonne et Chantal se sont disputées à son sujet. « Je comprends bien, a dit Yvonne, que Michel est quelqu'un de très intelligent, d'assez doué, quand il raconte ses histoires on dirait un roman. Mais un homme doit avoir un but à atteindre, quelque chose qui le fasse bouger. »
Là-dessus, Chantal n'a rien pu répliquer. Grâce à ses amis elle avait pu trouver quelques postes, mais Michel les a refusés. Michel lui avait dit qu'il ne voulait pas travailler à plein temps, mais mi-temps ou bien à temps partiel. C'est ainsi qu'on appelait dans la famille le grand-père paternel de Chantal.
Pourvu que Michel consente à parler au Grand Chef!.

CURRICULUM VITAE

Nom: N/A
Prénom: Chantal
Âge: N/A
Profession: N/A

Résumé:

Chantal a raccroché et a repris sa télécarte. Yvonne a dit qu'elle doutait que Michel ait été remercié, que probablement, il a été simplement mis à la porte. Chantal était en train de vivre un vrai drame tandis qu'Yvonne faisait de l'esprit. Ce qui tracassait Chantal ce n'était pas tellement le fait que Michel ait été licencié, mais qu'il n'ait été capable de rien. Yvonne et Chantal se sont disputées à son sujet. Chantal avait pu trouver quelques postes pour Michel grâce à ses amis, mais Michel les a refusés. Michel ne voulait pas travailler à plein temps et préférait le mi-temps ou le temps partiel. Chantal espérait que Michel consentirait à parler au Grand Chef.

ghi nội dung ý tương tự nội dung: - Luôn hoàn thành các nhiệm vụ được giao, tham gia đầy đủ các hoạt động thi đua 
trong đơn vị cũng như các hoạt động ngoại khóa của nhà trường.
    - Luôn gương mẫu và có tinh thần trách nhiệm, có ý chí phấn đấu trong công tác.
    - Công tác chủ nhiệm tích cực có hiệu quả.
   - Có đầy đủ các loại hồ sơ sổ sách theo qui định.
   - Soạn giảng đầy đủ, đúng phân phối chương trình và kế hoạch giảng dạy.
   - Kế hoạch cá nhân rõ ràng, có chất lượng đăng kí cho các học kì hợp lí
   - Trình bày đúng mẫu, đúng quy định về tất cả các loại hồ sơ.   
   - Thực hiện nghiêm túc các quy định của chuyên môn và các qui định của nghành
   - Tham gia đầy đủ và nghiêm túc các buổi sinh hoạch chuyên môn của tổ, trường, nghành tổ chức.
   - Áp dụng công nghệ thông tin hợp lí, khoa học và phù hợp với nội dung bài học.
   - Thực hiện đúng tiến độ của chương trình.
   - Thực hiện tốt qui định về dạy thêm và học thêm.

- Chăm sóc và hướng dẫn tận tình cho học sinh trong quá trình học tập.
- Thường xuyên cập nhật kiến thức chuyên môn và tham gia các khoá đào tạo, hội thảo chuyên đề để nâng cao trình độ.
- Tạo môi trường học tập tích cực, sáng tạo và thân thiện để phát triển tối đa tiềm năng của học sinh.
- Giữ liên lạc thường xuyên và tương tác tích cực với phụ huynh để hỗ trợ học sinh trong quá trình học tập.
- Tham gia xây dựng và giữ vệ sinh, an ninh trường học.
- Tuân thủ các quy định về đạo đức, phẩm chất và kỷ luật của giáo viên để làm gương cho học sinh đồng nghiệp.
- Đạo đức nghề nghiệp cao, tôn trọng và giúp đỡ đồng nghiệp có những kết quả tốt trong công việc.

- Hỗ trợ học sinh trong việc giải quyết các vấn đề cá nhân và xã hội để giúp họ cảm thấy thoải mái để học tập tốt hơn.
- Tham gia xây dựng và quản lý các hoạt động văn hoá, đạo đức, thể dục thể thao và những hoạt động khác để giúp học sinh phát triển toàn diện.
- Tử tế và chính trực trong tất cả các hoạt động, đảm bảo sự minh bạch, trung thực và trách nhiệm trong quá trình giảng dạy và đánh giá.
- Tổ chức các hoạt động học tập, trao đổi kinh nghiệm và giải quyết vấn đề trên cơ sở hợp tác, đoàn kết để nâng cao hiệu quả công tác giảng dạy.
- Luôn cập nhật và nâng cao kiến thức chuyên môn, sử dụng các cơ hội nghiên cứu, đào tạo, đánh giá và phát triển bản thân.

根据以下资料，写出一篇论文总结，700字以上：第1章：绪论。本章主要介绍了研究背景及意义，也介绍了目前国内外线上商城研究现状，例如阿里巴巴、京东、ebay、Amazon等，说明了当前互联网时代线上商城系统的重要性，最后讲解了本论文的结构安排。
第2章：关键技术介绍。本章主要介绍了MD5加密技术、SSM框架、Vue框架、Mysql数据库、Redis，这些技术为本系统提供了技术支撑。
第3章：系统分析。本章详细描述了线上商城系统中软件层次架构的设计，系统功能模块的设计以及数据库的设计，充分考虑了系统的可扩展性和可维护性等方面，以确保设计的合理性和完整性。
第4章：系统设计。详细描述了线上商城系统的软件层次架构设计，系统功能模块设计，系统的数据库设计，
第5章：系统实现。本章详细介绍了整个线上商城系统功能的实现，涵盖了系统的各个方面，包括用户登录、商品浏览、购物车、订单管理等。最后展示了部分代码的实现。
第6章：系统测试。本章主要介绍测试方法和结果，详细展示了功能测试和性能测试的结果，并对测试结果进行详细分析和解释。通过测试，可以确认系统的稳定性和性能，强化系统的可靠性。
第7章：结论。回顾了本论文研究主题和研究意义，并详细分析了在开发和论文编写过程中的不足之处和下一步改进的具体方案。通过本文的研究，我们可以更好地理解如何高效开发一个的线上商城系统。 
本章主要介绍了线上商城系统使用的关键技术。首先介绍了信息加密算法MD5，其安全性和可靠性已经受到广泛的认可和应用。然后，本章详细介绍了SSM框架、Vue框架、Redis缓存技术和MySQL数据库等关键技术。SSM框架整合了Spring、Spring MVC和MyBatis三个流行的框架，使得Java Web开发更加方便和高效。Vue是一个流行的前端框架，可用于构建单页面和复杂的Web应用程序。Redis缓存技术是一种应对数据库压力的缓解措施，而MySQL数据库则是一种开源的关系数据库管理系统，具有可靠稳定的性能、兼容性好和易于使用的特点。这些关键技术使得线上商城系统具备稳定性和可靠性等优点，为商城系统的正常运行提供了坚实的技术支撑。本章主要介绍了系统分析的过程和结果。在系统可行性分析中，我们介绍了采用SSM框架进行开发的优点和特点，保证了系统的稳定性和灵活性。在系统开发环境中，我们列举了硬件和软件环境的配置，让读者了解系统开发和运行的基础环境。在系统需求分析中，我们分别从用户端和管理员端的角度出发，列举了各自的需求分析。用户可以进行注册、登录、浏览商品、添加到购物车、下单支付、查询订单等操作，而管理员可以管理用户信息、商品信息、订单信息和商品类型信息。针对用户对系统响应速度的要求，需要在开发过程中注意跳转时长不能过长。本章的分析结果为系统的后续设计和实现提供了参考。本章主要介绍了商城系统的系统设计部分，包括系统软件层次架构设计、系统的功能模块设计、系统的数据库设计以及系统的界面设计。通过MVC模式的使用，实现了系统的分层管理和功能模块的独立协作。数据库设计已画出E-R图，数据库表各表之间关联紧密。界面设计遵循操作界面简洁明了，网页加载速度快，可视化强的要求，使客户能以最快速度找到自己心仪的商品。本章主要介绍了系统的实现部分，包括环境配置和用户端、管理员端主要功能模块的实现。在用户端，实现了用户登录、注册、商品浏览和搜索、购物车管理、订单管理等功能。在管理员端，实现了管理员登录、用户管理、商品管理、订单管理、商品类型管理等功能。系统通过使用Java语言、Spring、SpringMVC、Mybatis、SpringBoot等开发框架，以及Tomcat作为服务器环境和MySQL作为数据库，实现了系统的各项功能模块。最终，系统能够实现用户在线浏览商品、购物、下单以及管理员对商品类型、用户、商品、订单等进行管理的全面功能。本章对系统进行了详细的功能测试，包括用户登录、商品浏览和搜索、购物车管理、订单管理、管理员登录及功能测试等。采用的是黑盒测试方法，能够全面评估软件的功能性和交互性。经过测试，系统稳定性和可靠性都得到了验证，测试结果全部通过。

本论文研究了一种基于互联网的线上商城系统。该系统使用了MD5加密技术、SSM框架、Vue框架、MySQL数据库和Redis缓存技术等关键技术，为商城系统的稳定运行提供了技术支撑。论文分为七个章节，分别介绍了研究背景及意义，关键技术介绍，系统分析，系统设计，系统实现，系统测试和结论。

在第一章，介绍了研究背景及意义，并概述了相对成功的线上商城如阿里巴巴、京东、eBay、Amazon等，指出了线上商城系统在当今互联网时代中的重要性，最后对论文结构作了简要说明。

第二章详细介绍了MD5、SSM框架、Vue框架、MySQL数据库和Redis缓存技术等三种关键技术。这些关键技术的使用使得商城系统具有稳定和可靠等优点，并为商城系统的正常运行提供了坚实的技术支撑。

在系统分析章节中，详细描述了系统中软件层次架构的设计，系统功能模块的设计以及数据库的设计，充分考虑了系统的可扩展性和可维护性等方面，以确保设计的合理性和完整性。

在系统设计章节中，详细描述了商城系统的软件层次架构设计、系统的功能模块设计、数据库设计和界面设计。通过使用MVC模式，实现了系统的分层管理和功能模块的独立协作，实现了系统的全面设计。

在系统实现章节中，详细介绍了系统的环境配置和用户端、管理员端主要功能模块的实现。在用户端，实现了用户登录、注册、商品浏览和搜索、购物车管理和订单管理等功能，在管理员端，实现了管理员登录、用户管理、商品管理、订单管理和商品类型管理等功能。

在系统测试章节中，详细介绍了系统的功能测试和性能测试。通过采用黑盒测试方法，全面评估了系统的功能性和交互性。通过测试，确认了系统的稳定性和可靠性。

在结论章节中，回顾了本论文的研究以及商城系统的优点和局限性，并分析了改进方案。论文研究可为高效开发商城系统提供参考，也为未来的研究方向提供了思路和建议。

综上所述，本论文的研究涉及了商城系统的各个方面，从技术选型到系统设计和实现，再到测试和改进，全面评估了线上商城系统的功能和性能。研究结果表明，该商城系统稳定性和可靠性良好，符合用户需求，具有一定的实际应用价值。
